result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua W Kooiman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Cause Injury/Operate-Control. Substance (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not possess or consume controlled substances without valid prescription.  Not possess drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges subject to jail policies.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua W Kooiman

defendant.name: Kooiman, Joshua W
defendant.address: W12370 State Road 16 And 60, Columbus, WI 53925

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by Attorney Bartelt

11:34 AM Cases called: 22CF136, 22CF248, 22CF234 and 22CF233. Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua W Kooiman in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Joshua W Kooiman. Agreement recited by State. In 22CF136 Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled guilty to count 1 of 22CF136. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. All remaining cases are dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 30 months. Conditions of probation include: 30 days jail, with Huber, no good time. Starts forthwith. $2323.00 fines and costs. 24 month DL revocation and 24 month IID. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. 179 days sentence credit. Bond on hand will be applied towards costs. 12:05 PM
Jury Instruction filed by Atty Bartelt
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:13 AM Cases called: 22CF136, 22CF234, 22CF233, and 22CF248. Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua W Kooiman in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Joshua W Kooiman. Matters are resolved. There are some issues with credit. Attorney Bartelt is to see the JA in Br. 3 and get a separate plea/sentencing date. 9:15 AM

9:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua W Kooiman in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt not in court. Court stated there was a letter filed on Friday requesting a reset. Court was out of office on Friday, unable to process the request. This will be reset. 9:10 AM
Return date scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
requesting a reset of the 05/02/22 return date filed by Atty Bartelt
Pretrial 4-5-22 at 9:00 am and Return date 5-2-22 at 9:00 am
Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Not leave the State of WI w/o prior written court approval. Standard felony conditions.

1:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Joshua W Kooiman appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Allison J Borsheim for Joshua W Kooiman appeared by video. Waived reading of complaint. Advisement of rights. Bond recommendations. $1000.00 signature bond. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Not leave the State of WI w/o prior written court approval. Standard felony conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 1:35 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return date scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
